Genre: Documentary, Nature
"Life" is a new and spectacular nature documentary series produced by the BBC. Ten chapters filmed in HD pursuing an ambitious goal: to be the definitive exploration of the diversity of the animal world. Throughout the series will see all kinds of amazing behaviors that challenge our concept of other beings that populate the planeta.Durante four years, the award-winning Natural History Unit of the BBC has visited every continent and environmental classes in search of the most amazing stories about the ongoing struggle for survival animal. Emotional behaviors, as a female giant octopus who gives his life for his offspring of hundreds of babies. Skills surprising, as large chimpanzees able to use tools in a whole new way. Or even the story of a coastal crappie that when it comes time to procreate, goes in search of fresh water ponds ... at the top of a waterfall to twenty feet high. All with a cinematic sense of relevance was already in the previous blockbuster BBC "Planet Earth." Each episode is dedicated to a group of animals (mammals, primates, birds, insects, amphibians ...), and all were techniques have been used last generation: special glasses for aerial shots, HD images taken from space, HD cameras for low light conditions or for shooting underwater sequences accelerated, something that has never before been logrado.Una novel series mark a reference point for all nature documentaries.
